title: Hey Riot. For future reference if you have to nerf champions because of an item you are adding
body:
the item is the problem.

Oh yeah also when it finally dawns on your balance team that the item is the problem and they nerf it, you should probably revert the nerfs on whatever champions you decided to make need the item to be viable.

That is all.

I understand your logic there, but that's not entirely true. 

If an item is meant to be used in the jungle, it's balanced for 95% of champions in jungle, but 5% abuse it, then there's no reason to nerf the item, since that in turn is a nerf to 95% of its users, while presumably just putting the 5% that use it at a 'balanced' level. That means you didn't actually solve the issue at all, since the champions that originally abused the item are still going to be stronger with that item than anyone else. 

It makes significantly more sense to instead nerf the champions that are unintentionally strong when using that item.

The problem is when they first nerf the champion
And then they nerf the item on top of that... which a lot of the time ending up with the champion ending up in a rather weak state... (and they are often left there for a long time)

I agree that champions who get nerfed due to an item, and then that item gets nerfed is a bad thing. 

However that's an issue with Riot failing to consider their past issues rather than an issue with the strategy of nerfing the champion before the item.

Going by that logic why was Cinderhulk even nerfed after the Sejuani nerfs?

It was balanced for Amumu and every other non-problem jungle tank.

But i was nerfed anyways.

That's a unique instance, since Cinderhulk was a strong item both in the jungle and in top lane.  Riot is known for disliking jungle items in the lanes. If one or two champions are able to do it they are fine with that, but when  smite pushes other summoner spells from a lane, purely due to an item, there's an issue.

In that specific instance the item should have been nerfed before the champion because they wanted to stop the item from being so efficient in lane. Had the item not made its way into top lane, then I do think just nerfing sejuani probably would have been enough.

I do agree though that nerfing sejuani and cinderhulk at the same time was extreme though, as it seriously hurt sejuani as a champion.  That was a mistake on Riot's part.
alot of people want to see summoner spell diversity and non-mandatory flash. Cinderhulk gave us that.
They should just remove flash for a patch or two and see how people react. Not react as in the 2381921873 whining thread posts, but react in how they adapt their gameplay.

This would be really interesting to see, I'll admit. However, it would also be like Riot just giving all immobile champs (Coughcough Ashe Coughcough) a massive middle finger and saying #YOLO to all mobile champs... i.e: Vayne.


I see downvotes in my future XD
Well they already have the middle finger with a a 500 rng blink on a 5 minute cool down compared to what everyone else gets.

Except Cinderhulk and Smite by extension was mandatory on certain champions. Just because it's not Flash that's picked 100% of the time for certain champions doesn't mean there is diversity, it just means the best option has shifted. 

Diversity would be picking Exhaust or Ignite depending on lane match ups.

It's a mixture that some champions have overpowered kits, they just don't have an item to pursue and make that kit strong as hell.

Sejauni for instance was only underpowered due to her horrific clear times in the past. As a champion, she was insane. Enter the Cinderhulk. Sejauni's weakness is vanquished by a single item and her true abilities shine. Then she takes the nerf bat. She's still great, and in a place she needs to be, but not with sated/botrk meta that is running rampant. Nerf the devo, you get the tanks back.
